items.title: Jessica Simpson Marks 8 Years of Sobriety: â€˜Alcohol Silenced My Intuitionâ€™
items.summary: â€œ8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,â€ Simpson wrote.
items.body: Jessica Simpson is celebrating eight years of sobriety. The singer, fashion entrepreneur and reality TV personality marked the milestone on Friday (Nov. 1) with a reflective Instagram post , sharing how giving up alcohol transformed her life and creativity. â€œ8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,â€ Simpson wrote. â€œMaking that decision allowed me to fully live in the pursuit of Godâ€™s purpose for my life. Alcohol silenced my intuition, blocked my dreams and chased my circulating fears of complacency.â€ She continued, â€œToday I am clear. Today I am driven by faith. Both fear and faith are something that we feel and may not see, Iâ€™m so happy I chose faith over fear. It was not in the fight that I found my strength, it was in the surrender.â€ View this post on Instagram A post shared by Jessica Simpson (@jessicasimpson) The â€œWith Youâ€ singer has been open about her journey to sobriety since revealing in her 2020 memoir Open Book that she quit drinking in 2017. Earlier this year, Simpson told The Cut that getting sober also reshaped her songwriting process. â€œEvery time I would write, I was a littâ€¦

items.title: Tame Impala Resurrects â€˜Sundown Syndromeâ€™ at Halloween BarclaysÂ Show
items.summary: Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameo.
items.body: Tame Impala pulled a few tricksâ€”and fan-favorite treatsâ€”out of the vault on Halloween night in Brooklyn. Kevin Parker brought his Deadbeat Tour to Barclays Center on Thursday (Oct. 31), performing the live rarity â€œSundown Syndromeâ€ for the first time in seven years. The psych-pop gem, originally released as Tame Impalaâ€™s debut single in 2009, hadnâ€™t appeared on a tour setlist since 2018. The moment came midway through night three of a four-night sold-out run at the arena, with Parker and his touring band all dressed in costumes nodding to Parkerâ€™s â€œscarf-eraâ€ aesthetic from the early 2010s. The Halloween chaos didnâ€™t stop there. Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameoâ€”inside the showâ€™s bathroom cam. Parker has famously included a backstage toilet feed on tour to give fans a surreal behind-the-scenes moment mid-set. This time, Andre took over the screen, sharing a quick on-camera kiss with Parker, eliciting laughter and cheers from the crowd. â€œSundown Syndromeâ€ joins a string of surprises from the Deadbeat tour, which kicked off earlier this week in Brooklyn with the debut of several new tracks and a cover of Justiceâ€™s â€œD.A.N.C.E.â€ The run supportsâ€¦

items.title: Dodgers seal back-to-back World Series titles
items.summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers become the first team for 25 years to win back-to-back World Series after overcoming the Toronto Blue Jays in the deciding seventh game.

items.title: Drake Supports Hometown Blue Jays at Game 6 of the WorldÂ Series
items.summary: Also attending the game were Rush frontman Geddy Lee, Schittâ€™s Creek stars Eugene Levy and Annie Murphy and more.
items.body: Drake stepped out in full hometown hero mode on Halloween night (Oct. 31), attending Game 6 of the 2025 World Series at Rogers Centre in Toronto as the Blue Jays attempted to clinch their first championship since 1993. The rapper, who has been trolling Los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani on social media throughout the series, was among a stacked lineup of celebrities cheering on the Jays in their showdown against L.A. â€œOctoberâ€™s Very Own is back at the #WorldSeries,â€ MLB captioned a post on X , sharing footage of Drake arriving in the stadium. His appearance was part of a Halloween-night spectacle that included a whoâ€™s who of Canadian royalty and celebrity fans. Also attending the game were Rush frontman Geddy Lee, Schittâ€™s Creek stars Eugene Levy and Annie Murphy, former tennis pro Eugenie Bouchard, and Sliders actor Jerry Oâ€™Connell. Baseball legends Paul Molitor and Jack Morris â€” both World Series MVPs with the Blue Jays and Twins respectively â€” were also spotted in the stands. Drakeâ€™s recent Instagram Story posts have only amplified his sports-fan persona. After Game 5, he shared a photo of Ohtani wearing a sweater vest, cheekily captioned â€œONE MORE!!!!!!!â€ before following â€¦

items.title: Villa & Man Utd want Endrick - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Aston Villa, Manchester United and Lyon are keen on Real Madrid striker Endrick, Napoli want Manchester United's Kobbie Mainoo in January and N'Golo Kante could make return to France, plus more.

items.title: Mullins wins at Breeders' Cup with Ethical Diamond
items.summary: Ethical Diamond wins the Breeders' Cup Turf with a stunning late run in a course record for Grand National-winning trainer Willie Mullins.

items.title: Fans booing and players snubbing the manager - an 'abject' day for Spurs
items.summary: Despite being third in the table and unbeaten in the Champions League, all is not rosy at Tottenham after Chelsea inflict another home defeat.

items.title: Liverpool showed character to beat Villa - Slot
items.summary: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says his side showed great character as they beat Aston Villa 2-0 to end their Premier League losing run.

items.title: Leaders Hearts in 'dreamland' but might it get even better?
items.summary: Chief executive Andrew McKinlay thinks Hearts are destined to eventually win the Scottish title, but could it be this season?

items.title: Palace end winless run with victory over in-form Brentford
items.summary: Crystal Palace end a three-match winless run in the Premier League with victory over in-form Brentford at Selhurst Park.

items.title: Gomez shines as Brighton claim comfortable win over Leeds
items.summary: Diego Gomez nets twice and Danny Welbeck scores for third successive league game as Brighton comfortably beat Leeds to move into the top-half of the Premier League table.

items.title: Fulham condemn 10-man Wolves to eighth defeat of season
items.summary: Wolves' season continues to spiral after Fulham condemn them to another damaging defeat to keep them winless and bottom of the Premier League.

items.title: Arsenal go seven points clear with win over Burnley
items.summary: Premier League leaders Arsenal continue their impressive start to the season with a comfortable win at Burnley to make it nine consecutive victories in all competitions.

items.title: Late Amad volley earns Man Utd point in thriller at Forest
items.summary: Amad Diallo lashes home a thunderous 81st-minute volley to earn Manchester United a point in a thrilling Premier League encounter with Nottingham Forest at the City Ground.

items.title: Pedro goal gives Chelsea deserved win over lacklustre Tottenham
items.summary: Joao Pedro ends his 10-game goal drought to give Chelsea a deserved victory as Tottenham were booed off after another dismal home performance.

items.title: Salah scores as Liverpool end losing streak with win over Villa
items.summary: Mohamed Salah scores his 250th Liverpool goal as the Reds end their four-game Premier League losing streak with victory over Aston Villa.

items.title: 'I can't see a weakness' - is this Arsenal's time for a title?
items.summary: It is, of course, still early days but could this be Arsenal's time to win the Premier League? BBC Sport takes a look at why the Gunners' title charge is already looking strong.

items.title: Macclesfield overpower Totton in nine-goal tie
items.summary: Danny Elliott scored a first-half hat-trick for Macclesfield to help his side to a 6-3 victory against AFC Totton.

items.title: Faith in style pays off for St Mirren on All Saints Day
items.summary: Stephen Robinson might bridle at his team's reputation for physicality, but his players have delivered a League Cup final place.

items.title: England's Ashes hopes end with 'reality check'
items.summary: England have been handed a "good reality check" in seeing their Rugby League Ashes hopes ended by Australia, says captain George Williams.

items.title: Bompastor backs 'class' Hampton after Earps comments
items.summary: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor says goalkeeper Hannah Hampton has shown "class" in response to Mary Earps' comments about her.

items.title: Non-league Brackley Town beat Notts County on penalties
items.summary: Brackley Town win 4-3 on penalties against Notts County in the first round of the FA Cup.

items.title: Earl and Pollock make case for backline experiment
items.summary: England back rows Ben Earl and Henry Pollock show the pace to back Steve Borthwick's bold tactical plan.

items.title: Gerrard came 'very close' to Rangers return

items.title: Mariah Carey Announces â€˜Itâ€™s Timeâ€™ for Christmas 2025 in Ad WithÂ Sephora
items.summary: Carey's holiday season welcome in partnership with Sephora co-stars Billy Eichner.
items.body: Mariah Carey ‘s welcome to the Christmas season is here. The “All I Want for Christmas Is You” hitmaker made an official announcement to kick off the holidays in partnership with Sephora. “Halloween slayed,” Carey says in the Joseph Kahn-directed ad that dropped as Halloween (Oct. 31) came to a close. “But now … it’s time!” There’s one problem: Someone’s rummaged through the pop diva’s Sephora bag and pilfered the new beauty goodies she snagged for the 2025 holidays. In the lighthearted spot, Carey demands someone spill the tea on who stole her makeup so she can ring in the season of her modern Christmas carol, and — spoiler alert — it’s not the Grinch. It’s Billy Eichner as an overworked elf advocating for better treatment at Christmastime. “Bad news, Mariah Carey,” the comedian taunts. “The elves are striking this year. Elf revenge for putting us through holiday hell! Santa’s helper quit. I’m pawning this so I can afford elf therapy!” “That’s my blush, elf boy,” Carey says. “Your lipstick? I’m taking it. No bells. No châ€¦

items.title: 'Embarrassing' Wolves savaged as relegation looms

items.title: Pitch invader arrested after lining up with Australia team

items.title: FA Cup round-up: Gateshead and Carlisle provide first-round shocks
items.summary: Carlisle United and Gateshead provide the biggest shocks of the FA Cup first round with away wins over EFL opponents Reading and AFC Wimbledon.

items.title: Does 'timeless wonder' Welbeck deserve England recall?
items.summary: Danny Welbeck last played for England in 2018 but will his recent form at Brighton be enough to encourage Thomas Tuchel to select him for this month's World Cup qualifiers?

items.title: Dyche wants VAR to rule on corners after 'farcical' decisions
items.summary: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche calls for VAR to overrule wrongly awarded corners after a second decision goes against his side.

items.title: Will Old Firm raise bar of mayhem another notch at Hampden?
items.summary: Celtic and Rangers meet in Sunday's Premier Sports Cup semi-final after a period of internal strive for both sides of the Glasgow divide, writes Tom English.

items.title: 'Absolutely incredible' goal sends Buxton into second round
items.summary: Connor Kirby scores an "absolute worldie" in extra time as Buxton beat Chatham Town 2-1 in the FA Cup first round.

items.title: The Best 2025 Halloween Costumes From Lady Gaga, Megan Thee Stallion, Justin Bieber, Victoria Justice & MoreÂ (Updating)
items.summary: Here's a roundup of the best 2025 celebrity Halloween costumes.
items.body: With Halloween falling on a Friday this year, it looks like we’re getting two full weekends of Halloween celebration. Things kicked off last week, with Victoria Justice hosting her “Love Zombie” Halloween & Single Release Party in Los Angeles and embodying her new song by dressing up as the titular undead character. Bette Midler ‘s New York Restoration Project Hulaween Gala hit New York City over the weekend, and Midler hit the red carpet dressed as her own Divine Miss M persona next to Andy Cohen as Andy Warhol. Other celebs at Midler’s party: Ben Platt and husband Noah Galvin as Hugh Hefner and a Playboy Playmate, Darren Criss and wife Mia Criss as New York clowns, and Michael Kors and husband Lance LePere as taxi drivers. Related The 25 Biggest Halloween Songs of All Time on the Hot 100 But some stars didn’t need a party to get dolled up. Paris Hilton took to Instagram to show off her “Oops… I Did It Again!”-era Britney Spears costume , complete with red latex bodysuit. “Oops, I did it again … Starting off #Halloweek by honoring my Queen @BritneySpears,” Hilton captured the series of photos and vidâ€¦

items.title: Ruthless Sinner beats Zverev to reach Paris final
items.summary: A ruthless Jannik Sinner takes apart Alexander Zverev to reach the Paris Masters final and move within one win of regaining the world number one ranking.

items.title: Arteta lauds 'exceptional'  Arsenal defence in win at Burnley
items.summary: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta is full of praise for his side's defensive display in their 2-0 win against Burnley at Turf Moor.

items.title: Man City secure sixth successive win despite West Ham battle
items.summary: Aoba Fujino's goal is enough to secure a Manchester City win, despite bottom-of-the-table West Ham United fighting hard to create chances.

items.title: Chelsea continue unbeaten start with win over London City
items.summary: Chelsea maintain their unbeaten start in the Women's Super League with a 2-0 victory over London City Lionesses with an early goal from summer signing Ellie Carpenter and substitute Sam Kerr scoring late on.

items.title: Barnsley score 91st-minute winner to beat York City
items.summary: Marc Roberts scores in the 91st minute for Barnsley to earn a 3-2 win against York City in the first round of the FA Cup.

items.title: Swiatek and Rybakina earn dominant WTA Finals wins
items.summary: Iga Swiatek and Elena Rybakina produce statement opening victories on the first day of the WTA Finals in Riyadh.

items.title: Australia beat determined England to clinch Ashes
items.summary: Australia edge a much-improved England to win the second Test 14-4 at the Hill Dickinson Stadium to clinch a 14th consecutive Ashes series triumph.

items.title: Kali Uchis Named a 2025 ASCAP Women Behind the Music Honoree & More UpliftingÂ Moments
items.summary: Plus, Lele Pons & Guaynaa celebrate their first Halloween as parents.
items.body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight uplifting moments in Latin music. Hereâ€™s what happened in the Latin music world this week. Kali Uchis to Receive Special Honor Kali Uchis has been named a 2025 ASCAP Women Behind the Music, alongside honorees Kehlani and KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ lead vocalist EJAE. â€œEvery year, ASCAP looks forward to spotlighting some of musicâ€™s most extraordinary women by honoring them for their achievements at our Women Behind the Music event,â€ said Nicole George-Middleton, ASCAP Executive Vice President & Head of Creative Membership, in a statement. â€œThis year we are thrilled to recognize three women who are pushing boundaries and capturing the world’s attention across different genres. Their creative success has propelled them to the top of the charts and is set to inspire the next generation of women in music.â€ The Colombian artist will receive her award at the 17 th annual ASCAP Women Behind the Music event, taking place Wednesday, Nov. 12 in Los Angeles, just weeks after her Superstar Q&A at the 2025 Billboard Latin Music Week in Miami lastâ€¦

items.title: â€˜Saturday Night Liveâ€™ Livestream: How to Watch the Comedy Show Online Without Cable forÂ Free

items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Season 51 went on a short break after Sabrina Carpenter hosted and performed as musical guest a few weeks ago. Miles Teller is set to play host, while Brandi Carlile is set as musical guest during this week’s Saturday Night Live on Saturday (Nov. 1). SNL airs on NBC at 11:30 p.m. ET/PT. Want to watch SNL online without cable? Your easiest bet is to grab a free trial to DirecTV or FuboTV to stream an NBC live feed online without needing a subscription. GET: DIRECTV 5-DAY FREE TRIAL Keep reading to learn all the other streaming options to watch SNL online without cable. How to Stream ‘Saturday Night Live’ for Free In order to watch SNL , you’ll need to have access to NBC. If you have cable, then you just need to look up what channel NBC is on, which you can find it in your channel guide through your cable provider. Don’t have cable? There are a few ways to watch Saturday Night Live online for free. Your best bet is to subâ€¦

items.title: India and SA prepare for game-changing World Cup final
items.summary: There is history on the line as India and South Africa prepare for the Women's World Cup final on Sunday, with a new winner guaranteed for the first time in 25 years.

items.title: Why England fans should not lose Ashes hope despite ODI series defeat
items.summary: England's batting was concerning in their 3-0 ODI series defeat by New Zealand but it does not mean fans should give up Ashes hope, writes Matthew Henry.

items.title: Oasis Ends 19-Year Drought With Blinding First Concert of Australian â€˜Live â€˜25â€™Â Tour
items.summary: â€œNice one for putting up with us for so many years,â€ Liam told the faithful in Melbourne, many of whom flew from interstate or New Zealand for the occasion. â€œWe f***ing love ya.â€
items.body: The reunion of Oasis , of the long-feuding Gallagher brothers, isnâ€™t so much the stuff of legend, a surprise no one saw coming, or a comeback of the ages. Chalk it down as a rock â€˜nâ€™ roll miracle. Fans had given up hope long ago. Oasis split proper in 2009, following another backstage row, and any flicker of hope was snuffed out two years later when acrimony turned legal. Even the Gallaghersâ€™ mom Peggy stepped in, pleading for her boys to bury the hatchet. All to no avail. That was half a world away, a lifetime ago. Miracles do happen. Australians were witness to one Friday night, Oct. 31, as Oasis swept into Melbourneâ€™s Marvel Stadium, the opener for the Australian lap of their Live â€™25 world tour, and their first show on these shores in 19 years. The Victorian capital is always buzzing at this time of the year. The Melbourne Cup Carnival is underway, so too is Halloween, and at month’s end, the towering Melbourne Cricket Ground hosted an international cricket match, the visiting Indian menâ€™s team taking on the national team. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Oasis (@oasis) On showday, Oasis t-shirts are the dress code for Melbourneâ€™s CBD. In every cafÃ©, on everyâ€¦

items.title: Taylor Momsen Rocks New Version of â€˜Grinchâ€™ Song â€˜Where Are You Christmas?â€™
items.summary: The reimagined version appears on the bandâ€™s new holiday EP, Taylor Momsenâ€™s Pretty Reckless Christmas, released Oct. 31.
items.body: Taylor Momsen is revisiting a holiday classic â€” with a rock twist. The Pretty Reckless frontwoman has re-recorded â€œWhere Are You Christmas?â€ 25 years after first performing the song as Cindy Lou Who in How the Grinch Stole Christmas . The reimagined version appears on the bandâ€™s new holiday EP, Taylor Momsenâ€™s Pretty Reckless Christmas , released Friday (Oct. 31) via Fearless Records. The original ballad, co-written by Mariah Carey, James Horner, and Will Jennings, first appeared on the 2000 filmâ€™s soundtrack and was famously performed by Momsen at just seven years old. That same year, Faith Hillâ€™s version reached No. 65 on the Billboard Hot 100. Momsenâ€™s 2025 update opens with a nostalgic snippet of her childhood recording before launching into a full-blown rock version, anchored by crunchy guitars and her signature gritty vocals. â€œWhere are you, Christmas? Why canâ€™t I find you?â€ she sings, giving the wistful lyrics new energy and edge. The six-track EP also includes four original songs â€” â€œI Wanna Be Your Christmas Tree,â€ â€œChristmas Is Killing Me,â€ â€œBlues on Christmas,â€ and â€œWhen We Were Youngâ€ â€” as well as a reprise titled â€œChristmas, Why Canâ€™t I Find You.â€ â€œ Pretty Reckless Chrâ€¦

items.title: 'I deeply hurt people by moving to Saudi Arabia'
items.summary: In an interview with BBC Sport, Ashleigh Plumptre says she regrets losing the trust of some LGBT fans in women's football by moving to Saudi Arabia.

items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.
